required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Comparison of Depth of Sedation Performance Between SedLine and Comparator Device During General Anesthesia
clinical_study.official_title: Comparison of Depth of Sedation Performance Between SedLine and Comparator Device During General Anesthesia

brief_summary.textblock: The primary objective is to compare the performance of Masimo's SedLine and the comparator's device systems during surgery. Relative accuracy of the individual depth of sedation indices will be compared.

detailed_description.textblock: Monitoring vital signs (pulse rate, respiratory rate, blood pressure, and temperature), respiratory, and anesthesia parameters is considered standard for managing patients during anesthesia. However, the end target organ of action for anesthetic agents (the brain) is not routinely monitored. Processed EEG-based monitor index such as Patient State Index (PSIâ„¢) have been shown to be useful in assessing brain activity during sedation and general anesthesia. Due to the absence of an invasive gold standard to measure sedation, accuracy of any sedation index cannot be computed. However, correlation with the anesthesia drugs or sedation scales are generally used to determine the performance of the sedation index.

primary_outcome.measure: Comparison of sedation indices performance across anesthesia range
primary_outcome.description: Using the drugs and the sedation score recorded during the surgery, the relative performance/correlation would be computed for both PSi and the comparator's sedation index. This correlation may be computed for various stages of sedation/anesthesia levels (induction, maintenance and recovery).

primary_outcome.measure: Comparison of sedation indices performance during EMG
primary_outcome.description: The correlation will be computed when EMG is present in the EEG signal. Masimo and competitor's EMG detection algorithm may be used to detect EMG presence in EEG.

primary_outcome.measure: Comparison of sedation indices performance during Burst Suppression State
primary_outcome.description: The correlation will be computed when burst supression is present in the EEG signal. Masimo and competitor's burst supression detection algorithm may be used to detect burst supression presence in EEG.

primary_outcome.measure: Comparison of sedation indices performance during low power EEG from aging brain (70-90 years)
primary_outcome.description: Using the drugs and the sedation score recorded during the surgery, the relative performance/correlation would be computed for both PSi and the comparator's sedation index from the aging brain ( 70-90 years). This correlation may be computed for various stages of sedation/anesthesia levels (induction, maintenance and recovery).

intervention.description: Subjects will receive electrodes that compare EEG signals between Masimo's SedLine system and the comparator's system.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients 18 years old and older at the time of consent.
- ASA status I, II, or III.
- English-speaking subjects.
- Scheduled for surgical and non-surgical procedures scheduled under general anesthesia (Common procedures include but are not restricted to tonsillectomy, adenoidectomy, urological procedures, dental rehabilitation, orthopedic procedures, biopsies, audiogram, nuclear scans, gastroscopy, colonoscopy, etc.).
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any deformities or devices that may prevent application of EEG Sensor to forehead with a proper fit.
- Subjects who are developmentally delayed.
- Subjects deemed not suitable for study at the discretion of the investigator.
